intro: Pseudopodospermum inconspicuum, commonly known as the inconspicuous pseudopodospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical or subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists studying plant diversity in the region.
